page.title: 01Peterborough, Orton/Fletton
page.content: This area to the South East of the City of Peterborough is one which shows the differing stages of the city's development. Old Orton Longueville dates back to 1200 AD, whilst most of Fletton dates from 1850 onwards. Orton Malborne is the second of the areas to be developed from scratch as part of Peterborough's expansion under the New Towns Act of Parliament in the 1960's. The area contains extensive brick workings and newer undustrial areas. Peterborugh has developed on the edge of the fen and none of this area is very elevated. Unemployment in the area is about 15% of the working population and those working find employment throughout the city, with some commuting to London. The area tends to experience mild weather though winds blow regularly across the fens.
